newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot resids steady to lower despite crude run.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot resids steady to lower despite crude run.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel prices were steady to down slightly Tuesday in sluggish trade, with mild weather pressuring some East Coast grades despite another rally in crude, industry sources said.
"There are some utilities asking about oil but I don't see many buying," said one cash trader, noting firm crude could help limit further downside for resid.

In New York Harbor, physical one percent again eased slightly to about $14.50, with some expecting more downside after reports a cargo for May 10-15 delivery sold at $14.00. Traders said May paper held steady in the $14.25-50 area.
NYH Q1 one percent paper sold at $14.85.

NYH 0.3 percent high pour slipped 15-20 cents to about $15.25 on reports New York Power Authority awarded its 200,000 barrel HP tender for May 5-15 delivery at $15.50 and $15.55 (delivered), traders said.
High sulphurs in New York also lost some ground, with 2.2 percent off a quarter to $14.00-25.
At the U.S. Gulf, prices were stable, with one percent still at $14.50 and three percent at $13.25.

New York city gate gas for May delivery slipped a few cents to the mid-to-high $2.30s/mmBtu, or $14.99 a barrel equivalent. May gas at Henry Hub, the NYMEX delivery point, was quoted unchanged at $2.10/mmBtu, or $13.23 a barrel.
